name: Espurr
clearingStrategy:
Just basically follow what the
tutorial says
srankingStrategy: Following the Tutorial will S-Rank this easily

name: Bulbasaur
srankingStrategy:
Even without the Move+5 the tutorial gives,
Following the tutorial will S-Rank this

name: Squirtle
clearingStrategy:
Basically match Super-Effectives
here. On the lower right of the
board is 3 Bulbasaur. Use another
Bulbasaur to trigger Power of 4
and its HP depletes by half
srankingStrategy:
Basically you can S-Rank this without much
effort. You will mostly use 2-5 moves here

name: Charmander
clearingStrategy:
You are introduced to abilities
here. Follow the tutorial and this
will end in 2 turns
srankingStrategy: Will S-Rank it if you follow the tutorial

name: Eevee
clearingStrategy:
Just match anything you want.
You will finish this within 2-5
turns.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 turns left
Not that hard since you will not use that
many moves anyway
notes:
This may be your first Pokeball fail.
If so, you'll get your first (and only)
free Great Ball which will make its
capture rate at about 90~%.

name: Pidgey
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a Rock
Timer: Adds a Rock after every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
You are first introduced to Disruptions.
Its not really hard. Just match anything
near the rock to remove it away. You'll
finish this within 2-7 turns
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left
Not really hard to S-Rank. You will not take
that much moves even with your first team

name: Togepi
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a Rock
Timer: Adds a Rock after every 2 turns
clearingStrategy:
Disruption is now every 2 turns. Still
relatively easy to beat.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Still not hard to beat and S-Rank
notes:
You may fail to catch this one. 
You dont need to come back here
for now if you fail to catch it.

name: Pichu
disruptions:
Board: 2nd and 5th Column are Rock
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
Match Pokemons near the blocks to
clear them. You have 3 Pokemons
here so combos will trigger
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Again, its not hard
notes:
Pretty low catch rate. You may
fail catching this even if you
try. Dont bother redoing this
stage if you fail. (Come back if
you have ground types)

name: Audino
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a Rock
Timer: Adds a Rock after every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Not much to say here. Its a pretty
straightforward stage. Just make sure
to trigger combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
(Will S-Rank this even with 5 moves left)
You'll not take that much moves anyway
notes:
The next stage is the Mega Stage.
Not sure if this is 100% catch rate
since the next tutorial after Mega
Audino uses it.

name: Mega Audino
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a Rock
Timer: Adds a Rock every turn
clearingStrategy:
Much like Audino. Just make sure you
remove the disruptions when needed
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left
Quite easy for a Mega Pokemon. You may
fail this if you dont combo enough
notes:
First Mega Stone. Also a Mega
Slot will replace your first
slot
ability: Mega effect: Erases all Pok√©mon within one space of the match.
